sequenceNextVal
The function is used when auto-numbering objects to assign the next ordinal value, the returned value is stored in the "Current value" field.
The function increments the sequence by 1
each time the function is called
.
For example, when using a function in an
expression
it is recommended to deactivate the "Calculate when creating new object" parameter to avoid assigning a number to an object that may not be saved after creation (the number will be lost).
Or, for example, if the When changing attributes used in the algorithm/When changing any attributes of this type values are selected as an automatic recalculation of the expression, then when changing the values of the corresponding attributes, the function can be called again, which in turn will lead to a change in the sequence number for the current object.
Syntax
sequenceNextVal
(sequenceIdObj)
Parameter
Purpose
sequenceIdObj
ID of an object of the
"Auto-numbering" type [
SYS_SEQUENCE
] (or a child type), through which an ordinal number is assigned to a specified object.
Note
Before using the
sequenceNextVal
function, create an instance of the
"Auto-numbering" [
SYS_SEQUENCE
] type (or a child type).
By default, the sequence value starts with 1. If necessary, the current value can be changed when configuring the instance or using the
setSequenceCurrVal
function.
Adding a function to the algorithm code is done from the "Additional" section of the algorithm editor.
When calling the function, a modal window opens to select the previously created auto-numbering sequence:
An integer value is automatically set to the specified object attribute. After creating a new object, it will be assigned the following sequence number.
